intro: Mercurialis tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly mercury or hairy mercury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa, and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces a capsule fruit that contains numerous tiny seeds. Mercurialis tomentosa is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various environments.
